subject: Design
subcategory: Design Disasters and What They Teach Us
title: The Hyatt Regency Walkway: A Simple Drawing Error
description: A fast breakdown of The Hyatt Regency Walkway: A Simple Drawing Error for builders.

hook.text: In 1981, two suspended walkways in a Kansas City hotel collapsed during a dance party. 114 people died.

buildup.text: The original design hung both walkways from a single set of long rods running from ceiling to floor.

discovery.text: During construction, a contractor changed to shorter rods. This doubled the load on the upper walkway's connections.

twist.text: The change seemed minor ‚Äî a fabrication convenience. No engineer re-checked the load calculations.

climax.text: The Hyatt collapse proved that small design changes can have catastrophic consequences if not re-analyzed.

punchline.text: A small sketch change killed 114 people. Details are life and death.

quiz.question: What caused the Hyatt Regency walkway collapse?
options: A construction change doubled the load on connections without engineering review
